title: Mis-aligned bounding boxes in test_batch_labels
body:
## ‚ùîQuestion
Halo,
When training on custom data, we are getting the following results in test_batch0_labels.jpg:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33690998/120762370-dbaa6480-c51e-11eb-8bb0-2351cf57e4f4.png)

The bounding boxes are not positioned over the leaves (the task is to detect leaves, the bounding-box-labels given should match the leaves).
We have tested our label-generation (we have access to a leaf-segmented version of each image, so what we do is automatically generate the  bounding box coordinates based on the min x,y and max x,y of each leaf). The labels we generate are plotting a bounding box such as this:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33690998/120763509-f5987700-c51f-11eb-8629-cdd7a2d6f8bf.png)

We save our bounding-box coordinates in the label-txt files, following the format: class, center_x, center_y, width, height. For example:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33690998/120764264-ac94f280-c520-11eb-873b-a8c54d2119ea.png)


What could be the problem?

I'm not sure if relevant, but we run the train with --img-size [416, 416]. The images are not 416x416 however. From what I understand, this will just increase the image size to 416 416. Could it be mis-aligning the bounding boxes? Can / should we run it without specifying --img-size?

Thanks a lot!
